column4: nmap doesn't appear to work, when I use the '-A' option for OS detection.  I can paste the output if needed.  But, is anyone else having this problem?
can you paste the output and the nmap command you used to http://paste.ubuntu.com, then link the page it creates in here, please?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/137851/  Then directly after that output it still displays the normal info such as IP and open ports found.  It just doesn't do any OS detection.
Looks like you ran into a known bug that hasn't been fixed yet: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nmap/+bug/288358
lemmie see if I can find a workaround =/
9.04 is Jaunty, the current development release due to be released in April

Looks like the nmap thing hasn't been fixed yet. There's a possible Debian patch waiting for a maintainer fix, and it might be fixed in Jaunty, but it doesn't seem there's a working Intrepid version yet.
You could always download it from the site and compile it from source if you're comfortable with that, but that's a messy solution :/
I think I can wait for Jaunty, it's about a month away right?
The current plan is to release it on April 23rd.
I'm not so comfortable with installing programs that already exist in the repositories.  I had a bad experience with that when I first started using ubuntu.

Yeah, that's an understandable attitude. I try not to do it myself. Only reason I suggested it was that I've compiled nmap before (on OS X) and it has relatively-few dependencies. Let me go check if Jaunty's nmap works.
erk. I got a different error from you, and it still didn't work.
hang on a couple of minutes and I'll throw some more tests and see what's going on.

Looks like I'm getting the same error as https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nmap/+bug/331303 . I'm gonna take a look at the nmap package tonight and see what the heck's going on with it, but I have to leave now, so that's all the info I can give you for now.
alright man, thanks.  I'll keep an eye on those bugs, hopefully it will be fixed by jaunty, I can live with that.
I actually gotta go, too peace
